Case: Brooklyn-Ballard-MVA-02-28-2024. Client: Brooklyn Ballard.

On March 26, 2024, a forwarded email chain pertaining to the Brooklyn-Ballard matter was sent from Aries Penaflor of Whaley Law Firm to multiple Filevine addresses for Brooklyn Ballard and related parties, including Elizabeth Ballard and Deena Gilliam. The email carried the subject FW: 17-63X2-00X and was dated 15:28:20 on March 26, 2024, with a -0400 time offset.

The forwarded message shows a subsequent exchange beginning with a note indicating a message from Justin Chumbley of Whaley Law Firm, including his contact information: Whaley Law Firm, Ph: (502) 583-4022, Fax: (502) 364-9363. The header lines display: From: (blank in the forwarded excerpt), Date: Tue, Mar 26, 2024 at 3:14 PM, Subject: FW: 17-63X2-00X, To: Aries Penaflor, followed by the sender’s identifying block for Justin Chumbley.

The body of the original message that was forwarded originates from automedicalclaims@statefarm.com, sent Tuesday, March 26, 2024 at 3:13 PM to justin@whaleylawfirm.com, with the subject 17-63X2-00X. The message requests that the recipient open the attached documents for more claim information or next steps. It warns not to include sensitive personal information in an email—such as Social Security numbers, credit/debit card numbers (financial account numbers), driver’s license numbers, or health/medical information—and notes that if such information must be transmitted to State Farm, a claim associate should be contacted to request a secure email channel.

Additionally, the message encourages receiving a contact card for claims by texting AUTO to 62789 for Auto claims or HOME to 62789 for Homeowners claims, or by downloading the card to a mobile device. The State Farm notice includes the line “statefarm.com®” and is signed by Anne Perez | VAE65C (She/Her), Claim Associate PIP/MPC, followed by a closing from Aries Paul Peñaflor of Whaley Law Firm: “All the best, Aries Paul Peñaflor,” with Whaley Law Firm contact details: Ph: (502) 365-5788, Fax: (502) 364-9363.

The forwarded thread includes an earlier exchange. On January 13, 2025 at 4:18 PM, Sasha Williams, Tech III Chart Completion in Health Information Management, Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center (CCHMC), sent an email to ROI regarding the Authorization Form. The message listed Sasha Williams’s contact details: Office 513-636-4217 / Fax 513-636-6729, 3333 Burnet Ave MLC 5015, Cincinnati, OH 45229. The email concluded with a closing line signed “All the best, Aries Paul Peñaflor, Whaley Law Firm” and included Aries Penaflor’s office contact information: Ph: (502)365-5788, Fax: (502)364-9363.

Betty Houston replied on January 14, 2025 at 6:24?AM to Sasha Williams and ROI (cc: Aries Penaflor), confirming that the request for records had been received and would be submitted for processing. The message stated that the request would be processed in a timely manner and provided directions for questions: visit the hospital’s website at Obtain Medical Records | Patient Resources or call 513-636-4217, Option 1. The reply noted that the hospital does not respond to questions or status checks via email. It added that patients, parents, or legal guardians can now request medical records via DocuSign, and that the Authorization Form can be completed and submitted directly to the hospital using the link labeled “CCHMC Medical Records Request.”

A HIPAA Privacy Rule reminder was included: under the Privacy Rule, a covered entity must act on an individual’s request for access no later than 30 calendar days after receipt of the request, and if additional time is needed to complete the request, an extension notice will be provided per HIPAA requirements and the timeframe allotted. The message concluded with thanks and the hospital’s Release of Information contact details: Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center, Health Information Management Department, Release of Information, 3333 Burnet Avenue, MLC 5015, Cincinnati, OH 45229; Office: 513.636.4217; Fax: 513.636.6729.

The thread also shows the original sender as Sasha Williams, and the communications include the ongoing involvement of Aries Penaflor of the Whaley Law Firm, whose contact information is listed as above.
